channel.title: Make your first program in Java
channel.description:
You want to start off and make a hello world app right? so, first you want to declare your class name, lets say.. firstApp
[b]public class firstApp[/b]
its [b]public[/b] because we want to be able to access it, it can be also [b]private[/b] but we dont want it to be. its class (duh) because its java and firstApp is the name of the application we chose.
we now need to add our brackets [b]{
}[/b]
in this is where ALL the code for that class goes otherwise you get errors.
in those brackets put this
[b]public static void main(Sting args[]) {
}[/b] its public because we want to be able to access it, it can be [b]private[/b]. [b]static[/b] means that only one instance of a given variable exists for a class. [b]void[/b] means these methods don't return any values. and main as its the [b]main[/b] method in that class and the [b](String args[])[/b] .. you will learn how to use that later and once again[b] brackets [/b]have to be setup.
ok, now your class is perfectly setup, you can put things in the main method, lets say that we want to print "Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!"
so in the [b]main[/b] method (and in its brackets) put
[b]System.out.print("Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!");[/b]
now you can save it as [b]firstApp.java[/b].
now make a new text file
paste this into it:
[i]@echo off javac -cp . *.java pause[/i]
Save it as [b]Compile.bat[/b]
now make a new text file and paste this in:
[i]@echo off java -cp . firstApp pause[/i]
Save it as [b]run.bat[/b]
then first double click on [b]compile.bat[/b] and wait for it, then double click on [b]run.bat[/b]
if you get an error, make sure you have [b]JDK[/b] installed, just search on www.google.com for "JDK Download" if you still get errors look further down in this post
and wallaa you see "Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!"
so you say what next?
id suggest looking at doing math in java like this:
[b]int number1 = 1; int number2 = 2; int number3 = number1+number2; System.out.println(number1+" + "+number2+" = "+number3);[/b]
Note: your putting that in the main method.
int is integer which is a number, just have a play around!
ok, if your getting errors still, you have not have file extensions viewed so that your calling your files actually firstApp.java.java so read on from here

ehh…If you guys are going to flame him, then why even look?

Because the human is cruel. If we can’t express ourselves we aren’t human.

Very true, but imo, constructive feedback is more beneficial than discouraging criticism.

Yeah but hopefully if we flame him enough we will stop posting (and hopefully go kill himself) then there will be no need to give constructive comments…
[/quote]

Not sure if that will work, but hey! lets test it out on you first?[/quote]
Sounds like a plan.

item.title: Make your first program in Java
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

These sorts of tutorials, unless they are excellent, will be flamed! It’s because who in their right mind who is thinking of learning java would go into a java forum and look for threads teaching them everything there is to know?!? There is no one! People would go to a site on the web/buy a book which tells them everything there is to know! It’s common sense to get it from just one place…

Anyway, my point is, there is absolutely no point in any tutorial really on these forums unless they’re a cut above the rest, which will almost never happen, or they are specific knowledge which is not often known.

Overall, all the recent tutorials (and most of the rest, including the gui tutorial that I made (going way way back now)) are absolutely pointless so really, why waste your time writing them when it could be spent much more productively actually writing programs which benefit people or yourself!

Read full topic
item.source: Make your first program in Java

item.title: Make your first program in Java
item.dc:creator: @moparsc4p3 moparsc4p3
item.description:
@moparsc4p3 wrote:

You want to start off and make a hello world app right?
so, first you want to declare your class name, lets say… firstApp

public class firstApp

its public because we want to be able to access it, it can be also private but we dont want it to be.
its class (duh) because its java and firstApp is the name of the application we chose.

we now need to add our brackets
[b]{

}[/b]

in this is where ALL the code for that class goes otherwise you get errors.

in those brackets put this

[b]public static void main(Sting args[])
{

}[/b]
its public because we want to be able to access it, it can be private.
static means that only one instance of a given variable exists for a class.
void means these methods don’t return any values.
and main as its the main method in that class
and the (String args[]) … you will learn how to use that later
and once again brackets have to be setup.

ok, now your class is perfectly setup, you can put things in the main method, lets say that we want to print “Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!”

so in the main method (and in its brackets) put

System.out.print(“Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!”);

now you can save it as firstApp.java.

now make a new text file

paste this into it:

@echo off
javac -cp . *.java
pause

Save it as Compile.bat

now make a new text file and paste this in:

@echo off
java -cp . firstApp
pause

Save it as run.bat

then first double click on compile.bat and wait for it, then double click on run.bat

if you get an error, make sure you have JDK installed, just search on www.google.com for “JDK Download”
if you still get errors look further down in this post

and wallaa you see “Hello Universe, The World is Smaller Then You!!”

so you say what next?

id suggest looking at doing math in java like this:

int number1 = 1;
int number2 = 2;
int number3 = number1+number2;
System.out.println(number1+" + “+number2+” = "+number3);

Note: your putting that in the main method.

int is integer which is a number, just have a play around!

ok, if your getting errors still, you have not have file extensions viewed so that your calling your files actually firstApp.java.java
so read on from here

Read full topic
item.source: Make your first program in Java
